009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import java.awt.Polygon;
012
013import ij.IJ;
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
016import ij.gui.Roi;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.FloatPolygon;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021
022/**
023 * ImageJ plugin demonstrating the extraction of vertex points 
024 * from a user-selected polygon ROI (region of interest).
025 * Two different versions are shown using
026 * integer coordinates and floating-point coordinates, respectively.
027 * Notice that the ROI is obtained from the associated {@link ImagePlus} instance 
028 * (to which a reference is stored in the {@link #setup(String, ImagePlus)} method) 
029 * and not from the {@link ImageProcessor} {@code ip}.
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public class Get_Polygon_Roi_Points implements PlugInFilter {
035        
036        ImagePlus im;
037        
038        public int setup(String args, ImagePlus im) {
039                this.im = im;
040                return DOES_ALL + ROI_REQUIRED;
041        }
042
043        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
044                Roi roi = im.getRoi();  
045                if (!(roi instanceof PolygonRoi)) {
046                        IJ.error("Polygon selection required!");
047                        return;
048                }
049                
050                IJ.log("ROI integer coordinates:");
051                Polygon pgnI = roi.getPolygon();
052                Pnt2d[] ptsI = new Pnt2d[pgnI.npoints];
053                for (int i = 0; i < pgnI.npoints; i++) {
054                        ptsI[i] = Pnt2d.from(pgnI.xpoints[i], pgnI.ypoints[i]);
055                        IJ.log(i + ": " + ptsI[i].toString());
056                }
057                // alternative: ptsI = RoiUtils.getPolygonPointsInt(roi);
058                
059                IJ.log("ROI float coordinates:");
060                FloatPolygon pgnF = roi.getFloatPolygon();
061                Pnt2d[] ptsF = new Pnt2d[pgnF.npoints];
062                for (int i = 0; i < pgnF.npoints; i++) {
063                        ptsF[i] = Pnt2d.from(pgnF.xpoints[i], pgnF.ypoints[i]);
064                        IJ.log(i + ": " + ptsF[i].toString());
065                }
066                // alternative: ptsF = RoiUtils.getPolygonPointsFloat(roi);
067        }
068        
069}
